title: For Sale:  Boo!  Toledo Tactical
postcontent: I had a one and only experience with Toledo Tactical.  A company that has there name posted but there are apparently nowhere to be found.  Maybe for reasons such as mine.  I bought a lower receiver from this company at one of the local gun shows.  It appeared to be nice and the price was right for me.  It was a billet New Frontier with Toledo Tacticals stamp on it.  Once I began assembly of the parts, I found the any magazines mounted in the mag well we're so sloppy loose that the bolt catch pin would release the magazine follower essentially making last shot hold open null.  I also found the take down and pivot pin holes were grossly oversized about 7/1000th which when any upper receiver was installed on it that it was so sloppy loose that I could clearly see daylight through the entire gap between the two receivers.  The issues with the receiver is not my problem.  It happens.  It may say something about a low budget receiver like what New Frontier has always built, but it's not a retailers fault they are built that way.  It is however the retailers fault for selling such items, whether knowingly or not, and not dealing with the customer to potentially resolve the issues.  I tried calling the only phone number I could find for Toledo Tactical, four times.  Two times, a guy answered and said he would pass the message along to his partner to have him get back in touch with me.  That never happened.  I called two more times thereafter and received only a voicemail.  I gave up trying two months ago with hopes of maybe seeing them at another gun show.  They never went there again either.  So, it is what it is.  If nothing ever amounts to anything for me on this, at least I am passing this along for others to understand.  And I may just keep posting this as long as I keep getting my kicks out of it and for the fact I have nothing to sell currently.  Happy shootin,  be safe.
